description: To carry out tree surgery- to cut back by 20% one Oak at T1 within TPO 247
decision_conditions: The oak is situated between 45 Woodstock Drive and the rear garden of 45A Woodstock Drive, and appears to be in good health. It has an attractive maiden crown and appears to not have had a crown reduction in the past.

The tree has moderate to high amenity value as the tree can be seen by the public and surrounding properties on Woodstock Drive, Witney Close and Malcolm Road, and contributes to the local arboricultural characteNo arboricultural reason has been provided for reducing the crown by 20%. The crown appears to be over 2m from the front of 45 Woodstock Drive.
It appears from the application that dead wood / branches may be present in the tree - dead branches are exempt from TPO applications and may be removed.r of the area.

This application is rejected on the grounds that the work is currently unnecessary, and no arboricultural reason for the work has been provided. This work will have a negative impact on the visual amenity and arboreal character of the area.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
